Lloyd's Register collaborates with a range of government agencies globally to support the development and implementation of policies, regulations, and initiatives that promote environmental standards and reduce emissions in the shipping industry. Some examples of their current collaborations include:

1. IMO - Lloyd's Register has been working closely with the IMO to support its greenhouse gas reduction strategy, which aims to reduce emissions from the shipping industry by at least 50% by 2050, compared to 2008 levels.

2. EU - Lloyd's Register provides technical and advisory assistance to EU member states and EU institutions to promote sustainable shipping practices and improve the marine environment.

3. UK - Lloyd's Register collaborates with the UK government and industry stakeholders to help achieve the country's target of net-zero emissions by 2050. They provide technical expertise on decarbonization and sustainability initiatives across all sea transport modes, including shipping.

4. China - In partnership with the Chinese government and other stakeholders, Lloyd's Register supports the development of low-carbon shipping through the promotion and adoption of innovative and sustainable technologies.

Overall, Lloyd's Register participation in government-led activities is mainly through technical support, data collection, analysis, collaboration with stakeholders, and implementation of streamlined processes that heavily represent sustainable business practices. Their contributions support government initiatives towards sustainable development, decarbonization, and improving the health and well-being of people, communities, and the planet.
